title: US Congress letterhead
content:
Some of the Congressional offices use Cloister Black or some approximation, but several of the committees (and maybe the Senate) use this typeface. I assume it might be hand-cut, but I thought I'd ask if anyone recognized it, or knew the history of the usages.

Thanks!

Font: 

 Goudy Text 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131114/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [HAC letterhead.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131114/http:/typophile.com/files/HAC%20letterhead.png) | 42.37 KB |
author: pat

comments.content: **[Goudy Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131114/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Monotype%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Goudy%20Text%20MT%20Std%20-%20Regular&fid=edaa194143326714ea7055a15a36c8fa&fsize=48&text=Congress%20of%20the%20United%20States%20House%20of%20Representatives%2020515-6015&wrap=2)** by Monotype looks very close - if not an exact match
I think that is a match, actually. Thanks!
